dbeab121-6224-4339-9dc2-d8d48843b74f.description: The earner of this badge has demonstrated the expertise, knowledge, wisdom, and skills to facilitate high-quality learning experiences. The educator has incorporated reflection and culturally responsive practices. The faculty who have earned this badge are prepared to design future courses and mentor others in the course design process. KSU Online has created this credential to honor the commitment it takes to design, develop, and deliver student-centered learning experiences for KSU students.
dbeab121-6224-4339-9dc2-d8d48843b74f.name: Online Teaching Certification

badge_template_activities.title: We are extremely excited that you have decided to participate in the KSU Course Design Academy. The Course Design Academy is designed to facilitate a comprehensive and fun opportunity for faculty and administrators to design a student-centered learning environment supporting both enhanced face-to-face and online course delivery. This course is foundational to earning the KSU Online Teaching Badge. The self-paced course is approximately 4-6 weeks in length.

The review process is triggered by a faculty request for consideration. If faculty members deem they are ready for the review process, the Office of Online Education initiates the self-review, and peer review processes with the faculty members. The final phase of this process is a demonstrated teaching and learning session led by the Office of Online Education.

To earn the KSU Online Teaching Certification, faculty must submit a fully designed and developed Blackboard course through the three-tiered review process facilitated by the Office of Online Education (OOE). The three tiers include Self-Review, Peer-Review, and a final review by the OOE Team.

7cf21968-2897-48cc-8424-89728e626c69.description: The earner of this badge has demonstrated the ability to design student-centered courses in which program objectives, course objectives, student learning outcomes, learning activities, and assessments are well aligned. The earner also incorporates active learning experiences that are accessible, culturally responsive, and engaging. The course design must incorporate Quality Matters Standards and practices outlined by the Association of College and University Educators (ACUE) framework.
7cf21968-2897-48cc-8424-89728e626c69.name: Quality Course Design

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of the Course Design Academy offered by KSU Online staff, including guided tours/show-and-tell sessions with KSU Online team members.
Participation in the Course Design Academy (without completing it successfully) + completion of a module self-review and guided tour/show-and-tell with KSU Online members.
Successful completion of the first half, Blocks 1 & 2, of ACUE’s course on Effective Online Teaching Practices (EOTP)*

In lieu of the Course Design Academy, faculty members may submit their course for review. The submission of a completed course includes the same three-tiered process (self-review, peer-review, and KSU Online team members review). Successful completion of the review process will result in the earning of the KSU Course Design Badge.
